trash(com.google.android.gms.common.api..Description: Moves the resource to trash. The user must be the owner. If the resource is a folder, the app must have access to all descendants of the folder. Resources inside the app folder cannot be trashed.

getMetadata(com.google.android.gms.commo.Description: Retrieves the Metadata associated with this resource.

addChangeSubscription(com.google.android.Description: Adds a change subscription for this resource that will deliver events to the application event service. The event service class implementation should contain an implementation of @B_com#google#android#gms#drive#events#ChangeListener_E@ and be exported in the application manifest. The subscription is persistent until the next device reboot and will be active until the @B_com#google#android#gms#drive#DriveResource#removeChangeSubscription_E@ method is called on the same resource.

addChangeListener(com.google.android.gms.Description: Adds a new listener for changes on this resource. The listener will remain active for the duration of the current @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient_E@ connection or until the @B_com#google#android#gms#drive#DriveResource#removeChangeListener_E@ method is called with the same listener argument.

getDriveId().Description: Returns the DriveId that uniquely identifies this resource.

Returns: A PendingResult which can be used to verify the success of the operation.
Parameters: The @B_com#google#android#gms#common#api#GoogleApiClient_E@ to service the call. The client must be connected before invoking this method.
untrash(com.google.android.gms.common.ap.Description: Moves the resource out of the trash. The user must be the owner. If the resource is a folder, the app must have access to all descendants of the folder. Resources inside the app folder cannot be untrashed (they cannot be trashed in the first place).

Parameters: The non-empty set of parents to move the item to. Do NOT modify the set after calling this method.
setParents(com.google.android.gms.common.Description: Sets the parents of this resource. If successful, the resource parent set will be changed to the one specified in the parameter. The existing parent set will be overwritten. The caller must make sure that the set contains all intended parents of the resource, including existing parents that should remain as parents. The parent set must contain at least one parent. All parents must be folders. If this resource is in the App Folder or in one of its subfolders, all parents must also belong to the App Folder or one of its subfolders. If this resource is outside the App Folder every parent must also be outside the App Folder. This method is a generalized way of moving resources between folders.
setParents(com.google.android.gms.common.FullName: public abstract PendingResult<Status> setParents (GoogleApiClient apiClient, Set<DriveId> parentIds)

The set of changes that will be applied to the Metadata. Only include the specific fields that should be updated.
updateMetadata(com.google.android.gms.co.Description: Updates the Metadata that is associated with this resource with the changes described in the @B_com#google#android#gms#drive#MetadataChangeSet_E@. Note that the user must have edit access to update the metadata (see @B_com#google#android#gms#drive#Metadata#isEditable_E@). Also, the metadata of the root folder cannot be updated.
